sentences.en: Automotive supplies into the market vanguard of the times!
sentences.cn: 成为汽车用品市场的时代先锋!

sentences.en: Behind the vanguard were 38 columns guarding 38 four - horse chariots.
sentences.cn: 在前锋的后面是38列纵队,护卫着38辆四马战车.

sentences.en: Buffett's answer: a low - cost stock index fund with a company like Vanguard.
sentences.cn: 巴菲特回答: (购买)象先锋集团那样的公司(发行的)较低费用的指数基金.

sentences.en: However, as the vanguard aluminum, Zhongfu Industrial repeated up what forces there?
sentences.cn: 然而, 作为铝业先锋, 中孚实业连番大涨还有何种力量的推动?

sentences.en: In a way they played a vanguard role.
sentences.cn: 在某种意义上说,他们起了先锋的作用.

sentences.en: In October 1970 moved to site: Baoding Vanguard Road, No.267.
sentences.cn: 一九七○年十月迁至现址: 保定市前卫路267号.

sentences.en: In the 19 th century Britain was in the vanguard of industrial progress.
sentences.cn: 石九世纪英国是工业进步的前锋.

sentences.en: Sir James was an immensely distinguished architect in the vanguard of his profession.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯爵士是一位非常杰出的建筑师，处于其专业领域的前沿位置。

sentences.en: Students and intellectuals have been in the vanguard of revolutionary change in China.
sentences.cn: 学生和知识分子一直是中国革命变革的先锋。

sentences.en: Such thinking puts Kodak in the vanguard of a movement reshaping the computer industry.
sentences.cn: 这种想法使得柯达走在了改造计算机产业运动的最前沿。

sentences.en: The company is proud to be in the vanguard of scientific progress.
sentences.cn: 这家公司以处于科学发展的领先地位而自豪。

sentences.en: The vanguard in the movement were priests and ministers who worked in the slums.
sentences.cn: 运动的先锋,是在贫民窟工作的神父和牧师.

sentences.en: The vanguard of the American army reached the Elbe, only fifty - three miles from Berlin.
sentences.cn: 美军先头部队到达易北河, 离柏林仅 五十三 英里.

sentences.en: The vanguard units started off last night.
sentences.cn: 部队前锋昨晚已经出发.

sentences.en: They are in the vanguard of technological advance.
sentences.cn: 他们是技术发展的先导.

sentences.en: Vanguard relegated after crashing to 75 - 67 defeat to Air Force.
sentences.cn: 前卫队以67:75败给空军队后,遭到降级.

phrases.tran_cn: 先进技术，先进生产工艺；万古科技

trans.tran_en: the leading position at the front of an army or group of ships moving into battle, or the soldiers who are in this position
